intro: Hiraea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican hiraea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Hiraea mexicana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
